metadata.Title: CVE-2020-10756 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: An out-of-bounds read vulnerability was found in the SLiRP networking implementation of the QEMU emulator. This flaw occurs in the icmp6_send_echoreply() routine while replying to an ICMP echo request, also known as ping. This flaw allows a malicious guest to leak the contents of the host memory, resulting in possible information disclosure. This flaw affects versions of libslirp before 4.3.1.

criterions.comment: qemu: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
